intro: Psammisia lanceolata, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. It plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and providing nectar for pollinators. Its botanical features make it an important species in xerophytic ecosystems.
